translations.translation: And you pass by them in the daytime and at night.
You pass by (their habitations) in the morning
You pass by their desolate habitations in the morning
You pass by (their ruined town) in the morning and at night.
And indeed you pass over them in the morning. –
Verily, you pass by them in the morning.
And most surely you pass by them in the morning,
and you pass by them in the morning
And lo! ye verily pass by (the ruin of) them in the morning
You pass by their ruins morning
And surely ye pass by them in the morning.
Indeed you pass by them at dawn
Verily, ye pass by their (sites), by day-
Verily, you pass by them in the morning.
You pass by them in the morning
You pass by them in the morning.
And indeed, you pass by them in the morning
[37:137] And indeed you pass by them, by their remains and [the remains of] their dwellings during your travels, [both] in the morning, that is, during the daytime,
(And lo! Ye) people of Mecca (verily pass by (the ruin of) them) by the towns of Lot: Sodom, 'Amura, Sabura and Daduma (in the morning

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text: { وَإِنَّكُمْ } يا أهل مكة { لَّتَمُرُّونَ عَلَيْهِمْ } أي: على أطلاعهم ومنازلهم المنقلبة بشؤم فعلتهم وقت ترحالكم إلى الشام، وهي على متن الدرب { مُّصْبِحِينَ } [الصافات: 137] إن كنتم سائرين في أسفاركم في الليالي، { وَبِٱلَّيلِ } إن كنتم سائرين في أيامكم، يعني: إن سرتم ليلاً تصبحون عندها، وإن سرتم نهاراً تمسون دونها
